question_text: What limitation might you encounter when using a multi-output adapter with HDMI, DisplayPort, and VGA simultaneously?
answer_options: Only one output may function at a time due to shared bandwidth
The adapter will automatically switch to analog output only
HDMI will always override other outputs regardless of device
Signal converters inside adapters require manual power input
correct_answer: Only one output may function at a time due to shared bandwidth
explanation: Many multi-output adapters are designed to support only one active video output at a time, due to bandwidth or chipset limitations.
